Detailed Description

Local process controler attached to any running process under the control of a FT protocol

Such a class should extended by a specific FT protocol in order to implement the local part of the control required by a FT protocol. By default method of this class allows to stop all running threads in a checkpointable state and take a snapshot of the process by checkpointing each stopped threads. The role of derivation is to attach the object to a community name in order that theses methods checkpoint the right community.

This object is also responsible to translate old gid to new gid in case of failure.

Such a class should be initialized and instanciate either in the FT::Ini::initialize method or by the Coordinator class that acts as a supervisor of all local controlers.
